Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
Then did I check the tears of useless passion –
Weaned my young soul from yearning after thine;
Sternly denied its burning wish to hasten
Down to that tomb already more than mine.
And, even yet, I dare not let it languish,
30 Dare not indulge in memory’s rapturous pain;
Once drinking deep of that divinest anguish,
How could I seek the empty world again?

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
But, with firm foot and tranquil face,
30 Held backward from that tempting race,
Gazed o’er the sands the waves efface,
To the enduring seas –
There cast my anchor of desire
Deep in unknown eternity;
Nor ever let my spirit tire,
With looking for what is to be!

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
We thought, ‘When winter comes again,
Where will these bright things be?
All vanished, like a vision vain,
An unreal mockery

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
‘O mortal! mortal! let them die;
Let time and tears destroy,
That we may overflow the sky
With universal joy!

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
And could we lift the veil, and give
One brief glimpse to thine eye,
Thou wouldst rejoice for those that live,
Because they live to die.’

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
The music ceased; the noonday dream,
70   Like dream of night, withdrew;
But Fancy, still, will sometimes deem
Her fond creation true.

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
Thy love I will not, will not share;
Thy hatred only wakes a smile;
Thy griefs may wound – thy wrongs may tear,
But, oh, thy lies shall ne’er beguile!
While gazing on the stars that glow
Above me, in that stormless sea,
I long to hope that all the woe
20   Creation knows, is held in thee!

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
Time stands before the door of Death,
10   Upbraiding bitterly;
And Conscience, with exhaustless breath,
Pours black reproach on me:
‘And though I’ve said that Conscience lies,
And Time should Fate condemn;
Still, sad Repentance clouds my eyes,
And makes me yield to them!’

Title: The Complete Poems
Author: Emily Brontë
HighlightText:
Not even to keep your priceless love,
Dare I, Beloved, deceive;
This treason should the future prove,
Then, only then, believe!
